content.question: A spherical balloon is inflated while it is under water, as shown. The balloon is inflated so that the diameter of the balloon increases linearly with time. Which of the following graphs best represents the buoyant force exerted on the balloon as a function of the balloon’s radius?

choices.label: The figure shows a line in the coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “Balloon Radius in meters,” and the numbers 0.0 through 2.0, in increments of 0.5, are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled “Force in newtons,” and the numbers 0 through 4, in increments of 1, are indicated. The line begins at coordinates 0.25 comma 0.5 and it moves up to the right passing through coordinates 0.5 comma 1, 1.0 comma 2, and 1.5 comma 3.

The figure shows a line in the coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “Balloon Radius in meters,” and the numbers 0.0 through 2.0, in increments of 0.5, are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled “Force in newtons,” and the numbers 0 through 4, in increments of 1, are indicated. The line begins at coordinates 0.25 comma 3.5 and it moves down and to the right passing through coordinates 0.5 comma 3, 1.0 comma 2, and 1.5 comma 1. The line ends at coordinates 1.75 comma 0.5.

The figure shows a line in the coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “Balloon Radius in meters,” and the numbers 0.0 through 2.0, in increments of 0.5, are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled “Force in newtons,” and the numbers 0 through 4, in increments of 1, are indicated. The curve begins at coordinates 0.25 comma 0, and it moves upward and to the right, gradually at first and then more steeply. It passes through coordinates 1.0 comma 0.5 and 1.5 comma 1.8. The curve ends at coordinates 1.8 comma 3.3.

The figure shows a line in the coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “Balloon Radius in meters,” and the numbers 0.0 through 2.0, in increments of 0.5, are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled “Force in newtons,” and the numbers 0 through 4, in increments of 1, are indicated. The curve begins at coordinates 0.3 comma 3.25, and it moves downward and to the right, steeply at first and then more gradually. It passes through coordinates 0.5 comma 2, 1.0 comma 1, and 1.5 comma 0.8. The curve ends at coordinates 1.9 comma 0.5.

content.answer: The figure shows a line in the coordinate plane. The horizontal axis is labeled “Balloon Radius in meters,” and the numbers 0.0 through 2.0, in increments of 0.5, are indicated. The vertical axis is labeled “Force in newtons,” and the numbers 0 through 4, in increments of 1, are indicated. The curve begins at coordinates 0.25 comma 0, and it moves upward and to the right, gradually at first and then more steeply. It passes through coordinates 1.0 comma 0.5 and 1.5 comma 1.8. The curve ends at coordinates 1.8 comma 3.3.

skill.text: 2.D: Predict new values or factors of change of physical quantities using functional dependence between variables.
